page.title: 13POWER CABLE-LINK TO FRANCE
page.content: The French cable-link has been a five-year project between France and Jersey. (Jersey's total dependence on oil for its electricity was felt to be unsatisfactory, as well as very expensive). It is a combination of a fifteen-mile underwater power-line, produced in France, and land-lines to the power stations at each end. It comes into the Island at Archirondel, at a building especially built to receive it. A computer- controlled satellie link between France and Jersey is a necessary part of the system. In May 1985 the power was switched on in stages. There were three power- cuts, due to a fault in the satellite alarm system, which was found to be over-sensitive. We are now receiving half of our power from France during the summer.
